title: Lewis and Clark National Historical Park: Fees & Passes
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Fees & Passes              Fees & Passes       Entrance Fees  16 and older - $5 per person - 7 days 15 and younger - free  Lewis and Clark National Historical Park Annual Pass The $20 annual park pass covers entrance fee for the pass holder and three other adults in a single, private, non-commercial vehicle at Lewis and Clark National Historical Park.    Oregon Coast Passes Pass covers entry, vehicle parking and day use fees at all Oregon State and Federal fee sites along the Oregon Coast.    Oregon Coast Annual Pass - $35 - valid for 12 months Oregon Coast 5 day Pass - $10 - valid for 5 days  National Parks and Federal Lands Passes  Pass covers entry for pass holder and three adults in a single, private, non-commercial vehicle.   Senior Pass - $10 - Lifetime of the pass. Must be a U.S. Citizen and 62 years and older. Access Pass - Free - Lifetime; Only disabled U.S. Citizen are eligible for this pass. Interagency Annual Pass - $80 - valid for 12 months Military Annual Pass - Free - valid for 12 months. Must be U.S. active military or dependent.  Every Kid in a Park Pass - Free - valid from September to August (school year plus summer) must be 10 years old or in the 4th grade. (For more information go to www.everykidinapark.gov )  For more information visit the National Parks and Federal Lands Passes website.
